87.title: "Cookie"
87.author: written and illustrated by Bill Dubay
notes: SUMMARY: Fourteen humor strips featuring a cast of various experimental life forms. I. Dubay, Bill. k. Experimental Life Forms. Call no.: PN6728.5.P3B6no.3

88.heading: Cookie.
88.title: "Eyuk!"
88.author: by Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Beetle looks into the pot and says, "Eyuk!" Cookie decides to adopt the designation and writes it on the menu.

89.heading: Cookie.
89.title: "He's Probably Mad at Him"
89.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Killer wonders why Cookie gives Otto the same dinner as he gives the soldiers.

90.heading: Cookie.
90.title: "I Can't Eat Anything with a Dog's Name"
90.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Cookie offers Otto some chow.

91.heading: Cookie.
91.title: "I Got Cookie a French Cookbook"
91.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Zero thinks Sarge's idea is funny, because Cookie can't read French.

92.heading: Cookie.
92.title: "I'm Afraid Cookie Has Some Sort of Bad News"
92.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: The men are lined up with empty trays, and Cookie is standing on a box behind the counter with his clothes all blackened and smoking.

93.heading: Cookie.
93.title: "It Lacks a Focal Point"
93.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Cookie feels like he's created a masterpiece, but the critics are hard on it.

94.heading: Cookie.
94.title: "It's Flattering the Way You Savor Every Bite of My Cooking"
94.author: by Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Cookie comments when Sarge empties his whole tray in one gulp.

95.heading: Cookie.
95.title: "Just Because I Like Bearnaise on my Doggy Biscuits"
95.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Cookie and Sarge are worried that Otto has become too much of a gourmet.

96.heading: Cookie.
96.title: "Pea Soup"
96.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Cookie serves chili on hot days, ice cream on cold days, and now it's foggy.

97.heading: Cookie.
97.title: "Splat is Undercooked, Boing is Just Right"
97.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Cookie shows how to tell if the meatballs are ready by dropping one.

98.heading: Cookie.
98.title: "You Guys are Just Lousy Eaters"
98.author: Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: To prove that complaints about his cooking are unjustified, Cookie has found a bunch of animals that enjoy his food.

99.heading: Cookie Jars.
99.title: "Are You Sure This Is How To Catch a Cookie?"
99.author: Larry Wright.
notes: Key words: Cookie jars, hunting blinds.

publication info.publisher: Western Publishing Company, in conjunction with Children's Television Workshop

notes: Summary: Cookie Monster and a clever, selfish witch are forced into an impossible situation: sharing cookies.
Text with illustrations; each illustration has word balloons.

105.title: "Cookie Stuffer"
105.author: by Greg Evans.
notes: Summary: Some older brothers are firefighters, athletes or lifeguards, while Brad is putting 30 Oreos in his mouth at once.

107.heading: Cookies.
107.title: "Are You Sure This Is How To Catch a Cookie?"
107.author: Larry Wright.
notes: Key words: Cookie jars, hunting blinds.

108.heading: Cookies.
108.title: "As the Snack Break Progresses, Sophie Begins to Tell Both Sides of the Story!"
108.author: LeDoux and Wilson.
notes: Summary: Sophie says Mr. Sterling is not just another deranged madman, and Mr. Sterling enthusiastically accepts a plate of raisin cookies from his daughter.

109.heading: Cookies.

110.heading: Cookies.

110.author: by Tim Barela

111.heading: Cookies.
111.title: "Can I Have the Hot Dog, or Did Your Mom Take It?"
111.author: Watterson.
notes: Summary: Calvin tries to make his mom give him cookies by threatening her with dynamite, which is actually a hot dog with a string for a fuse. Afterwards Hobbes asks about the hot dog.

112.heading: Cookies.
112.title: "Cool Cookies"
112.author: by Miguelanxo Prado
112.appears_in: p. 87-90 in Heavy Metal 20 Year Special (Heavy Metal Special ; v. 11, no. 2 (Fall 1997).

113.heading: Cookies.
113.title: "Don't They Screen for Cooties, Though?"
113.author: by Bill Amend.
notes: Summary: Giving blood isn't so bad, and they give you cookies. Paige wants to do it.

114.heading: Cookies.
114.title: "Escaping Into Virtual Reality"
114.author: by Bill Amend.
notes: Summary: Jason's bored with the real world, except for chocolate chip cookies.
Key words: Dinosaurs, spaceships, haunted castles, helmets, buckets.

115.heading: Cookies.
115.title: "Fortune Cookies"
115.author: Peter Kuper
115.appears_in: p. 74 in Heavy Metal, v. 17, no. 4 (Sept. 1993)
notes: Begins: You are the master of every situation.

116.heading: Cookies.
116.title: "Get Out the Milk and Cookies, Mom! It's Happy Hour!"
116.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Dennis runs in from the school bus.

117.heading: Cookies.
117.title: "Here's Your Half of the Cookie, Oscar"
117.author: by Frank Cho.
notes: Summary: Truman relents and gives him half the cookie, and Oscar tricks him out of the other half.

118.heading: Cookies.
118.title: "I'm In Cookies Now!"
118.author: by Garry Trudeau.
notes: Summary: Clyde visits. He lost his "hip angry pose" to Dale Carnegie, and is opening a local branch store.

119.heading: Cookies.
119.title: "Mike Tyson vs. the Gingerbread Man"

notes: Key words: Boxing, biting, headless, cookies.

121.heading: Cookies.
121.title: "Oh, All Right, You Can Have a Bite"
121.author: by Frank Cho.
notes: Summary: Brandy has given Truman a cookie, and he teases Oscar with it.

122.heading: Cookies.
122.title: "She'll Try to Pay Us with Stale Cookies, but if we Hold Out, She'll Finally Give Us a Quarter!"
122.author: by Fred Neher.

123.heading: Cookies.
123.title: "They are Pretty Delicious"
123.author: Walt Wetterberg.
notes: Summary: Mother made cookies and put them on the tree, and for a moment they were too pretty to eat.

124.heading: Cookies.
124.title: "Very Soon Now, You'll Be Handed a Fortune"
124.author: Olson & Kelso.
notes: Summary: In a Chinese restaurant, it's time for dessert: Fortune cookies. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "fortunes"

126.title: Cookie's Combat Tales
126.author: [No author]
notes: Korean War story in which G.I. circus acrobats rescue a P.O.W. from a third floor interrogation room.

127.heading: Cookies from Home.
127.title: "Because He Calls and Writes More Often, Beetle"
127.author: by Mort Walker.
notes: Summary: Beetle calls home to ask why his mother sent cookies to Sarge.

128.heading: Cookies from Home.
128.title: "Otto's Here to Sniff Out Any Suspicious Packages"

notes: Summary: Sarge and Otto are in the mailroom looking for cookies from home.
